comments:
I develop plugins for WebSphere Studio/Rational Developer. I prefer
M9, but I can't launch even an empty runtime workbench with it; note
that 3.0-M8 launches the same configuration. The following details are
repeatable:

0 Run I20040518 as devbench on blank devspace.

1 Import preferences: mine turnoff autobuild and set target platform,
  among other things.

2 Pull sources from CVS using Team Project Set. Afterward, make sure
  target platform remains correctly set! (Not in 3.0-M8.)

3 Select all plugins in workspace, rclick>PDE Tools>Update Classpath,
  fix any problems with

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=61669

  repeat 

4 mainmenu>Build All.

5 Make a kept-blank runspace, i.e. Run>Run>Run-time Workbench with
  "Clear workspace data before launching"=checked.

6 Add to Program Arguments

 -consoleLog -debug -showLocation

7 Run: with I20040518 launch fails with console=

> Configuration location:
>    
file:d:/eclipse/devspaces/v6.r3.3/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/keepThisBlank
on 1.4.2/
> Configuration file:
>    
file:d:/eclipse/devspaces/v6.r3.3/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/keepThisBlank
on 1.4.2/config.ini loaded
> Install location:
>     file:w:/eclipse/
> Framework located:
>     file:W:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.0.0/
> Framework classpath:
>     file:W:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.0.0/core.jar
>     file:W:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.0.0/console.jar
>     file:W:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.0.0/osgi.jar
>     file:W:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.0.0/resolver.jar
>     file:W:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.0.0/defaultAdaptor.jar
>     file:W:/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.0.0/eclipseAdaptor.jar
> Splash location:
>     W:\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.platform_3.0.0\splash.bmp
> Debug options:
>     file:d:/eclipse/builds/eclipse-3.0-M8-I20040518-win32/eclipse/.options not
found
> !SESSION May 19, 2004 14:06:51.379 ---------------------------------------------
> java.version=1.4.2_04
> java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
> BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
> !ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi May 19, 2004 14:06:51.409
> !MESSAGE Startup error
> !STACK 1
> java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "3:start"
>   at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:48)
>   at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:477)
>   at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:518)
>   at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.loadBasicBundles(EclipseStarter.java:372)
>   at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.startup(EclipseStarter.java:210)
>   at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:115)
>   at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
>   at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
>   at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
>   at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
>   at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:267)
>   at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:692)
>   at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:676)

  FWIW all of the above trace is blue.

8 Close devbench=I20040518. Start new devbench=3.0-M8 pointing to the
  previous devspace. Kill autobuild: 3.0-M8 seems unable to recognize
  later preferences, so it turns autobuild on, which fails massively
  since it also unsets my target platform preference.

9 Fix preferences, Build All.

10 Run the empty RTW config previously defined. After the usual blue
   reporting, 3.0-M8 will throw a long red trace beginning

> org.osgi.framework.BundleException: The activator
> org.eclipse.perfmsr.core.PerfMsrCorePlugin for bundle
> org.eclipse.perfmsr.core is invalid

  but then the RTW launches as desired.

11 Close devbench=3.0-M8, restart devbench=I20040518 pointing to the
   previous devspace, rebuild, rerun RTW: fails as previous.

Note that I initally thought the problem might lie with my I20040518
build, but I nuked/reinstalled it without change.

The config.ini syntax has changed a couple of weeks ago.  Therefore, as 
announced on eclipse-dev, you can't use builds from this week or last week to 
target M8, and you can't use M8 to target later builds.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 62434 ***
